parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It focuses on public health issues related to West Nile Virus and mosquito control.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content addresses public health concerns relevant to a wide audience in Romania. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad target audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to raise public awareness about West Nile Virus prevention and mosquito control. While indirectly related to public well-being, which could be a concern for political candidates, the post does not explicitly or implicitly endorse or oppose any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information on a public health issue, citing a biologist's opinion and providing factual data on mosquito control efforts.  The style and content align with informative journalism or citizen journalism, aiming to educate the public rather than influence votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it presents factual information and expert commentary on a public health matter.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>490076993441008</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, focusing on West Nile Virus prevention and mosquito control, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any explicit or implicit endorsement of a candidate or party. The content is primarily informative and educational, aligning with journalistic standards. The targeting of the advertisement, while broad, does not specifically target voters in relation to the parliamentary elections. The post does not violate Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, as it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda.  The post does not advocate for or against any candidate or party, and its objective is clearly public health education, not electoral influence.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Videomedicina.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
